title: Why don't people understand morale?
body:
I hold absolutely no respect for anybody who would say the following.

"I should have went (your role here)" Upon you dying once or twice

"Nice gank/Best gank" Upon you not pulling off a gank

"(Anything about them losing lane because of something very small that you did)

"(Complaining to the enemy team about someone who lost lane)"


Any demoralizing comments. Do people not want to win their games? I have to be honest, it is so easy to throw somebody on tilt just by saying one small thing. Hearing any comment like that makes me feel like shit. It really does.  I realize my mistakes, I do not need to hear you hold them against me and mock me all game. Even when you make one small mistake, there is that guy who is not going to trust or side with you on anything.

Morale plays a huge role in this game. Toxicity poisons your team, weakening them.

By all means, give constructive criticism. Its not what you say, its how you say it.

replies.body:
I had a game 2 days ago where I did actually receive one of these comments.

I had called mid, I was second round of picks, but first pick decided on going mid. I was like fine, went support instead. Our botlane started with a double kill (yay us) and then their mid and jungle would CONSTANTLY come to kill us. A lot of their attempts failed, but after third time being flash initiated against by 2 people NOT in my lane was just annoying as hell. Like..no exaggeration, they kept 4 people in bot lane for about 85 seconds pushing it. Top did not push, mid was freezing his lane.

I had to comment "Mid, can you at least try and push your lane because they're pushing ours and killing us".
He responded back with a snarky "*sigh* I should have gone support......gg"

Had he gone support I KNOW that my mid lane would not be roaming bot 3 times in 12 minutes without having taken a turret. Some people are just...dense.

I'm not one to really be affected by stupid comments, but I cannot try my hardest knowing I have an incompetent mid laner.

> [{quoted}](name=Orbv,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=XnfsF3Vd,comment-id=0008,timestamp=2015-07-21T16:07:19.589+0000)
> I'm not one to really be affected by stupid comments, but I cannot try my hardest knowing I have an incompetent mid laner.

His comment is even more ridiculous if we consider the fact that botlane was essentially turned into a 2 v 4 campsite.

Even the best support in the world is going to have a hard time against an ADC, a Mid Laner, a Jungler, and another Support.

And I mean "a hard time" as in, most of the time, the best outcome that an ally ADC and Support can hope for is to simply get out of that lopsided brawl - _alive_.
And thats why you should play a mage instead of support bot so you're actually useful in a 2v4. Instead of complaining about another lane doing well.
There's not a single mage that could handle a Xin/Janna/Lux/Sivir who are trying to both kill you and push your turret.
{{champion:157}} {{champion:34}} {{champion:63}} {{champion:99}} {{champion:76}} {{champion:27}}  just to name a few mages that seem to have no problem 1v4ing.

Yasuo is an ADC Caster. He deals **physical damage**, which is the more common to build resistances against and most champions have a higher Armor per level of.. Mages do ability damage. So in mentioning Yasuo, you're wrong.

When have you seen an Anivia or Singed Support? That in itself is amputating your team because they are much stronger scalers and cannot function without expensive items. Using them bot at all is a gimmick, AND you will not have enough mana to clear consecutive waves against Sivir.

I literally listed Lux as the champion I was up against, and then you listed her as a champion who can 1v4, which it actually was a 2v4. First....wow. Secondly, she has a HORRIBLE time 2v4ing. She has skillshots, her ultimate is reliant on landing an ability if you want to proc her passive or else a supporting Lux's damage is negligible. She has the 11th lowest health in the game, base and scaling wise. If you're going support mage Lux, you WILL NOT have the AP to push a wave and defend yourself.

Nidalee has no CC, and no wave clear, she literally cannot defend a turret against a dive/poke comp.

Brand...at lvl 6 he may be able to given that you landed another spell or else risk his ult going on only minions. It's possible to prevent the push, but he cannot stop a dive.

If you were seriously going to list champions who can 2v4, and yet have no relevance to the champions I listed out, you should have at least said:

{{champion:25}}  (AoE CC, Magical Protection, Wave Clear, Single Target CC, Spell Vamp for Sustain)
{{champion:3}} (AoE CC, Waveclear / Poke, up to +90 resistances)
{{champion:74}}  (Waveclear, AoE CC, Supported Defense, Health Regen)
{{champion:143}}  (Waveclear, 2 AoE CC)
{{champion:1}}  (AoE CC, Waveclear)

ALL better support choices.

Otherwise great players, with decent mechanics and game knowledge, have gotten salty and thrown. It's like they really think harassing a teammate will make them play better...

And the irony of it all, League, in spite of its toxic community, looks down on this behavior the most. One of my most positive friends on League is a shitter on other games. It's so weird

You'd be surprised how easily a 5 and 0 Pantheon can make a team want to surrender.

"If you fail a gank are you expecting me to stop CS'ing to write out a big explanation of what went wrong and how you can do better?"

No ... but you could say something like "wait until they're pushed next time"

Short and simple. And it's better than sarcastically saying "nice gank." 

"If you break that easily to a comment just mute and keep playing, or get thicker skin."

No one is breaking. He's saying that people being rude or making sarcastic remarks about poor gameplay can make him feel bad. Of course it can. Feeling bad is not the same as breaking and going into a fetal position with tears down your face. And usually when you feel bad then you play worse. It's just common sense. 

"it's a heavily competitive sport" 

lol 

Maybe at the pro level. But not for everyone else.

"if you didn't look down at yourself for fucking up a gank occasionally you wouldn't get better at the game"

If you're feeling bad or looking down on yourself then you're doing it wrong.

It's a game. The purpose of the game is to have fun. If you're not having fun, then you're not fulfilling the purpose of the game and there's no point in playing it.

> No ... but you could say something like "wait until they're pushed next time"

> No one is breaking. He's saying that people being rude or making sarcastic remarks about poor gameplay can make him feel bad. Of course it can. Feeling bad is not the same as breaking and going into a fetal position with tears down your face. And usually when you feel bad then you play worse. It's just common sense. 

I refer to breaking as going on tilt, if you can't handle sarcasm on the internet, don't come on the internet. Saying nice gank after you botched it up shouldn't be throwing you on tilt.

> lol

> Maybe at the pro level. But not for everyone else.

Heavily competitive*

Even in normals, you go in to win and have fun, if you let something that minor throw you off chances are it wasn't that comment that did it.

> If you're feeling bad or looking down on yourself then you're doing it wrong.

> It's a game. The purpose of the game is to have fun. If you're not having fun, then you're not fulfilling the purpose of the game and there's no point in playing it.

The purpose of the game is enjoyment, if getting better and winning is your enjoyment it shouldn't discourage you, if getting better and winning isn't your thing it still shouldn't discourage you.

The games Goal is to win, if you aren't following it's goal then don't play.
If the goal is to win, sarcastic criticism is bad. If you don't think you can say something constructive in time, don't say anything. Just making fun of your teammates is disrespectful at best.

A sarcastic comment is not making fun of someone.

If nothing negative is said you never improve, as long as something can come out of it, it doesn't matter how it's said.

Asking a nocturne why the hell he ulted into a 1v5 without us is negative, but it's going to force himself to question why he was being a moron.

sar·casm
ˈsärˌkazəm
noun
the use of irony to mock or convey contempt.

TO MOCK OR CONVEY COMTEMPT!

The Nocturne probably knows ulting into a 1v5 was stupid after he died. Dying is bad. If you died, you know not to do that again.

mock
mäk/
verb
verb: mock; 3rd person present: mocks; past tense: mocked; past participle: mocked; gerund or present participle: mocking

    1.
    tease or laugh at in a scornful or contemptuous manner.

Which leads to

scorn·ful
ˈskôrnfəl/
adjective
adjective: scornful

    feeling or expressing contempt or derision.

And finally.

con·tempt
kənˈtem(p)t/
noun
noun: contempt

    the feeling that a person or a thing is beneath consideration, worthless, **or deserving scorn.**


It is not being insulted. 

And if all it took for someone to learn was dieing, we would have a lot more good players, but instead we have players who will blame everyone else, The Nocturne might blame his team for not following in, or claim it was an accident etc.

Suggesting that a person is beneath consideration, worthless, or deserving scorn is not insulting them? Wow. I don't want to risk giving that impression with mere sarcasm, so I'll be blunt: that is really stupid. Of course it's insulting. If you can't handle being on the Internet without insulting people just because you think they're playing a game wrong, then YOU need to stay off the Internet, not them.

When I was in 10th grade I had to take gym class in summer school due to an academically rigorous schedule. Turns out my entire county all had gym summer school concurrently so there were about 400 kids in taking gym at the same time and we had a volleyball tournament set up with several teams. Well there was this spoiled rich brat in my class and on my volleyball team who was an absolute asshole and bully who threatened everyone, including the teacher, regularly. Every time we played a volleyball game any time we got scored on, or someone hit the ball out of bounds, he yelled at us and blamed us for being bad. We lost every game, eleven in a row I believe. 

Well, his being an asshole resulted in so many complaints from students and even parents that he got transferred out of my class and therefore also out of my volleyball team, after that we played the team who was up until then undefeated, and we beat them. We then proceeded to run the table and won every game we played until the tournament was over. I think we ended up 6-11 or something like that, but the fact is, this dude was such a negative boost on our morale that him simply being gone was all we needed to outperform even the best competition.

Of course morale has a huge effect League, just like any other team sport.
Why would it be magically different?
Morale has an even bigger impact on random strangers, because they need to trust each other enough to play together. Low morale makes people not trust each other, so they can't play together as a team properly.
Saying it has no effect after the game is over is outright untrue, winning or losing because of morale affects rank; winning increases your morale and makes you more likely to play well in the next game instead of going on tilt and throwing.

Unless you pre-emptively mute everyone before the game starts, ruining your ability to communicate with your team, you can't "just mute".
By the time you know that you need to mute someone, the damage has already been done.

Most enjoy defaulting to sarcastic, sly comments on the internet. Personally, I would never ever say anything negative if a teammate fails to do something. The only time I really talk in-game is pinging objectives or discussing strategies. All I say is "gj" or "nice" if my teammate does particularly well.

There's no reason for people to be condescending towards others when they don't succeed in their task.

I just had a game, the score was 17-19, my team was down in kills, BUT we had 3 drags and the enemy had 0, we had 4 towers on them, and our team started a surrender vote and it went 4-1. Simply because we didn't have more kills than the enemy team, they thought it was GG. I hate when we have a game that's going very well in our favor and then people give up.

I see this all too often in both ranked games and normals alike, it has been this way for 3 solid seasons (a bit more often in season 5 that 3 and 4), but regardless i don't really tend to say anything when something bad happens, but i like to tell them "gj", and more positive things along those lines to get them to feel better about it.  If i believe what i will tell them will help them then i will, and i will say it in a nice and polite manner, but i tend to be the more positive quiet kind of teamate. 

  In fact in a ranked game i had an adc who wasn't doing too well in lane, so i continued along, not saying anything, after a couple of deaths, he was like this game was over, but i continued to tell him that its not and we will be fine as long as we teamfight and peel for him.  We got their inhibitor, but i made an overly aggressive play on their fed adc, with which we killed their adc, but the enemy team got to dive our back line without any means of retaliation.  We lost the game, but I was glad that he gave it his best effort, regardless of the fact that he wasn't doing well.

As a support main when people yell at me for any reason and put me on tilt, i just ignore chat for a bit. I notice that people will just leave me alone when they realize that i'm never going to respond to their insults because they either think i muted them, or they (far too often) think that i have chat restriction ban or something. usually 3 things will happen, 

1) They keep up with the insults knowing i'm ignoring them(50% chance of winning)

2) They will pick another victim to criticize and harass making things worse because the next guy will retaliate thus causing us to lose at a faster rate

or

3) They afk, and we /ff

I know myself well enough to know that once i respond to the harass, all of a sudden i start typing like a 4 year old who just learned how to read because i'm angry and upset. i just continue to do what i can until its over but you better bet that i sure as hell will start to play with less clarity and awareness because your hurtful words kept me on tilt for the rest of the game.

II usually don't type in chat anyway as i tend to communicate 99% of the time via pings. 

And i'm pretty sure instead of typing "stop feeding scrub" you can instead type "Ward tri/river/baron" or "keep tabs on mini map" to survive most ganks, within the same time span....idk what makes some people think they have to use the tired excuse of "i shouldn't have to type an essay on what you did wrong and how to fix it" i feel like that response is an excuse so that angry people can continue putting others down without actually helping them.

One of my good friends always wants to play with another one of their friends when we play, and that person is RIDICULOUSLY mean. I'm not the best player, I can admit that, but there's only so many degrading, mean comments I can take. This person thinks it's a joke, but by the end of the game I'm just mindlessly walking into the jungle and feeding because I'm so on-tilt.
I don't understand why people can't just be nice about any criticism they have. You're so much more likely to have a good reaction.
